report_title: Lawn Sprinkler Installation Contractors in the US
executive_summary: Lawn sprinkler installers provide an essential service to the construction and renovation of nonresidential buildings, which is the industry's primary market. This market encompasses investments in office buildings, hotels, hospitals, factories, power plants, stores, schools and entertainment centers such as golf courses and stadiums. The economic fallout related to the COVID-19 pandemic significantly reduced activity within this sector, as new construction projects were halted or postponed due to government-mandated establishment closures. As the unemployment rate decreased following the widespread distribution of COVID-19 vaccines and the reopening of the economy, activity has rebounded.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: COVID-19 Restrictions Impeded Nonresidential Construction Work
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The COVID-19 pandemic and concurrent government-mandated shutdown of the economy diminished revenue from the nonresidential market. Offices and business establishments across the country were forced to close. Also, commercial building projects were either slowed, halted or ceased altogether. Work is often the last thing to be installed in a new structure, the stall in commercial construction over the pandemic has meant this market segment has taken longer to improve.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Residential Construction Boomed Amid The Pandemic Due To Favorable Interest Rates
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The residential construction market covers work performed on single and multi-family homes and apartment buildings. The residential market boomed amid the COVID-19 pandemic due to the urban flight of wealthy Americans. Those who could afford it left densely populated areas and relocated to suburban or rural parts of the country, refurbishing old homes or building new ones. This buoyed industry revenue over the past five years, mitigating loss from diminished commercial activity.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Majority Of Industry Companies Are Small In Size
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The industry is highly fragmented as lawn sprinkler installation contractors are generally small and compete in highly localized or regional markets. For instance, a competing industry enterprise employs less than five individuals on average and there are very few industry companies that operate on a national basis. High fragmentation and low barriers to entry have contributed to heightened competition over the past years as new operators seek to gain a foothold in untapped geographics amid rising demand.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Demand Will Improve Alongside Rising Disposable Income Levels
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Demand for the Lawn Sprinkler Installation Contractors industry will be characterized by broader economic improvements over the five years to 2029. Foremost, lawn sprinkler installers will benefit from increasing per capita disposable income, which support growth in private home improvement spending. Consumer trends adopted amid the COVID-19 pandemic, such as backyard renovations and outdoor entertainment spaces, are slated to benefit the industry in the outlook as well.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Industry Will Embrace New Technologies More Than Ever Before, Primarily As They Relate To Energy Efficiency
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: According to the Natural Resources Conservation Service, modifying irrigation systems can significantly reduce energy and costs. Both residential and commercial customers will demand energy efficient sprinkler systems to save costs and lessen their environmental impact, as well as to adjust to potential regulations. For instance, California adopted an efficiency standard for new spray sprinklers in the prior period that reduce irrigation system misting and overspray that is common around urban landscapes.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Demand For Repair Work Will Continue
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Lawn sprinkler installers will generate significant revenue through regular maintenance and repair work. Repair work is often more resistant to economic fluctuations, as keeping sprinkler systems in working order is considered essential for a household's quality of life. Revenue from repairs and maintenance is steady and provides lawn sprinkler installers with a stable source of income. Once interest rates stabilize, residential work will resume, albeit at a greatly subdued rate and with less volatility compared with the prior period.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry install and service plumbing for lawn sprinkler systems.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - steady

key_trends: Revenue for the Lawn Sprinkler Installation Contractors industry grew amid the COVID-19 pandemic. The residential market ferried the industry through the worst of the pandemic.
The commercial market rebounds from pandemic-induced lows. While this will help larger sprinkler installers in the long run, these companies will not see any short-term stimulus.

Demand from the residential market slows as mortgage rates continue to climb. With that said, there will always be a need for sprinkler services from residential clients for the purpose of maintenance and repair work, providing a reliable stream of income for the industry.
Certification is necessary to acquire high-revenue contracts. This lifts the quality of workmanship and ensures the work is up to standard.
Lawn sprinkler installers receive some support in the form of industry associations. This includes the Irrigation Association, which provide industry insights, certification, publications and shows.
Underground sprinkler installations remain the industry's largest service. Drip irrigation systems also account for a significant portion of demand.

Residential construction boomed due to COVID-19-induced low interest rates, but is now starting to decline as the Federal Reserve begins to spike up rates. Nonresidential construction is slowly recovering as activity within this sector has historically taken longer to improve post-recession.

Start-up materials include basic tools and related apparatuses (tool belts, toolboxes, transportation). Larger sprinkler contractors, such as those who service commercial clients, will want to have a surplus of sprinkler equipment and specialized pieces.
As lawn sprinkler installers operate on a regional basis, they congregate in line with the population. Areas with more people, such as urban centers have a high demand for sprinkler services.
Low concentration is a direct result of the relatively low barriers to entry. It is also due to the consistent revenue growth potential and expansive addressable market segments.

Sprinkler installation services are vital to downstream construction markets. Lawn sprinkler installers provide services that are required by both residential and nonresidential construction markets, making substitution a minor concern.
Profit fell over the past five years due to an unstable commercial market. Profit from sprinkler installations will grow as corporate profit climbs, though it will not reach pre-pandemic levels.
Wages have increased as a share of the average lawn sprinkler installers' revenue. The industry is labor-intensive and to date, there is no way to cut out that cost.

market_segmentation.segment_description: The commercial construction market includes work performed on office buildings, hotels, hospitals, factories, power plants, stores, schools and entertainment centers such as gold courses and stadiums. Over the past five years, this market has declined as a share of revenue due to stronger growth from the residential market, along with COVID-19 related downturns.

Expansion in residential housing has enabled this market segment to increase over most of the past five years. Multifamily residential work has been a particularly important demand driver since building managers often establish long-term maintenance contracts with lawn sprinkler installers, which steadies lawn sprinkler installers' work pipeline and stabilizes revenue.

products_and_services.product_description: The installation of underground sprinklers is the industry's most profitable and largest product segment. Since these sprinklers are completely out of sight, the client's lawn is left untouched and unblemished. These installations require highly skilled and knowledgeable workers, which further boost the price. Demand for underground sprinklers will continue offering the industry with the most work, especially as disposable income rises and consumers opt for more aesthetic lawns.

The majority of a drip irrigation system lies on top of the lawn, while a small portion is buried underneath. This provides a decent alternative to both underground and on-ground sprinklers and it is also priced accordingly between these two options. These systems are effective ways to water large land masses and are significantly cheaper when compared with underground installations.

These sprinklers lie on the surface of a lawn and is significantly less expensive when compared with both underground and drip irrigation systems. Most buyers of this segment come from the residential construction market. Home renovators often choose the most economical option and do not have a large area that needs to be serviced. Demand from this segment increased over the past five years as residential construction grew, especially amid the COVID-19 pandemic and associated low interest rates.

As lawn sprinkler installers operate on a regional basis, they congregate in line with the population. Areas with more people, such as urban centers have a high demand for sprinkler services.
Low concentration is a direct result of the relatively low barriers to entry. It is also due to the consistent revenue growth potential and expansive addressable market segments.

Sprinkler installation services are vital to downstream construction markets. Lawn sprinkler installers provide services that are required by both residential and nonresidential construction markets, making substitution a minor concern.

business_locations.location_description: The graph indicates that the percentage of establishments is highest in the Southeast region, around 30%.
The graph indicates that the population percentage is highest in the Southwest region, around 35%.
The Rocky Mountains region has the lowest percentage of both establishments and population, around 5% each.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Rising wage costs, along with the adverse effects that the COVID-19 pandemic had on the commercial market segment have contributed to the decline in profit.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: EMPLOYEE COMPENSATION REPRESENTS THE SECOND-LARGEST EXPENSE CATEGORY
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Rising wage costs can be largely contributed to labor shortages, which has placed an upward pressure on wages as contractors attempt to attract and retain employees.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: PURCHASES OF MATERIALS AND EQUIPMENT REPRESENT THE LARGEST INDUSTRY EXPENSE
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchased equipment and supplies are determined by the breadth of the contract and can vary in size and scale.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry is experiencing a low level of both the rate of new patents and the concentration of patents in the industry. This creates an environment where the threat of new technologies driving disruption is low.

Major market segments for industry operators are relatively diversified. The spread of market segments suggests that there are limited entry points other than those already served by incumbent operators.

volatility_points.volatility_title: VOLATILITY IS INFLUENCED BY THE CONSTRUCTION CYCLE
volatility_points.volatility_description: Lawn sprinkler installers provide services for a variety of markets and industries, as a significant portion of buildings uses some type of sprinkler system.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: DEMAND FOR UNDERGROUND SPRINKLERS HAVE INCREASED OVER THE PAST FIVE YEARS
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The installation of underground sprinklers is the industry's most profitable and largest product segment.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: DRIP IRRIGATION SYSTEMS ARE HIGHLY EFFICIENT AND COST EFFECTIVE
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The majority of a drip irrigation system lies on top of the lawn, while a small portion is buried underneath.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: ABOVE-GROUND INSTALLATIONS ARE THE CHEAPEST OPTION
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: These sprinklers lie on the surface of a lawn and is significantly less expensive when compared with both underground and drip irrigation systems.

FAQs.question: What are the key factors affecting demand in this industry?
FAQs.answer: Residential demand can be influenced by trends in consumer spending and disposable income levels, while commercial projects can fluctuate in line with corporate profit levels. Regular maintenance and repair work helps offset volatility and smooth revenue streams.

FAQs.question: What is the level of regulation in this industry?
FAQs.answer: The industry faces moderate and steady regulation.

FAQs.question: What is the level of industry assistance?
FAQs.answer: The industry receives low and steady assistance.

FAQs.question: What are some key data points about the industry?
FAQs.answer: In 2010, the industry had revenue of $2,073 million, 2,316 establishments, 2,300 enterprises, and 9,709 employees. Domestic demand was $600 million. In 2020, projected revenue was $2,546 million with 2,307 establishments, 2,290 enterprises, and 11,000 employees.

FAQs.question: How have industry metrics changed over time?
FAQs.answer: From 2010 to 2020, revenue grew 22.8%, establishments decreased slightly by 0.4%, enterprises decreased by 0.4%, and employment grew by 13.3%. Domestic demand is projected to grow 23.7% from 2010 to 2020.

FAQs.question: What are some key ratios for the industry?
FAQs.answer: In 2010, the IVA/revenue ratio was 32%, imports/demand was 32%, exports/revenue was 214%, revenue per employee was $214,000, and wages per employee were $61,844. The wages/revenue ratio was 4% and employees per establishment ratio is not provided.
